Parent Statute: Examination and treatment for emergency medical conditional and women in labor (EMTALA)
Document Description:
Section c outlines the responsibilities of the hospital at which a patient with an emergency medical condition arrived before that patient may be transferred. According to section (c)(1), a patient must be stabilized before being transferred to another medical facility unless: (A(i) the individual seeking care requests in writing a transfer to a different facility after being informed of the hospital's responsibility to provide care; (ii) a physician certifies that the medical benefits derived from a transfer outweigh the risks to the patient or the fetus of a pregnant person; (iii) in the event a physician is not present, a qualified medical person certifies the transfer as described in (ii) after consultation with a physician. 
The transfer must also be deemed to be appropriate.
File: Examination and treatment for emergency medical conditional and women in labor (EMTALA)
Entity Empowered: Department of Health and Human Services

Parent Statute: Examination and treatment for emergency medical conditional and women in labor (EMTALA)
Document Description:
Section c outlines the responsibilities of the hospital at which a patient with an emergency medical condition arrived before that patient may be transferred. Paragraph 2 states that an appropriate transfer must meet the following criteria: 
A. The transferring hospital can provide the medical treatment to the individual in a manner that minimizes the risk to an individual, and potentially a fetus' life. 
B. The receiving facility has the capacity and personnel to treat the patient and has agreed to accept the case and provide appropriate care. 
C. The transferring hospital sends all medical records and documents related to the emergency medical condition and patient to the receiving hospital
D. All necessary and appropriate life support measures are utilized during patient transfer
E. Meets any other requirements required by the Secretary of Health and Human Services.
File: Examination and treatment for emergency medical conditional and women in labor (EMTALA)

Describe Health Emergency: Must be a "national emergency declared by the President after January 1, 1953" or where otherwise authorized by law.

Document Description: Authorizes President to augment active forces for any named operational mission; President may authorize Secretary of Defense and Secretary of Homeland Security re: the Coast Guard (when not operating as a service in the Navy) to active duty for not more than 365 consecutive days.
Entity Empowered: Department of Defense,Department of Homeland Security,Department of Homeland Security - Coast Guard,Executive Office of the President of the United States
Describe Health Emergency: Must be in response to: (1) use or threatened use of a weapon of mass destruction; or (2) a terrorist attack or threatened terrorist attack in the U.S. that results or could result in significant loss of life or property.

Document Description: Authorizes the Secretary of Defense to call Reserves to active duty for up to 120 days to respond to a Stafford Act major disaster when requested by the governor of a state.
Entity Empowered: Department of Defense
Describe Health Emergency: Must be a declared "major disaster" under the Stafford Act.

Document Description: Authorizes the Secretary of a military department to augment active forces for a preplanned mission in support of a combatant command, using any unit of the Selected Reserve. Limitations are placed on appropriations and costs.
Entity Empowered: Department of Defense
Describe Health Emergency: Must be a pre-planned combatant mission that needs additional troops to augment it.

Document Description: May require any reserve to organize and perform duties in support of emergency preparedness programs to prepare or respond to specified emergencies.
Entity Empowered: Department of Defense
Describe Health Emergency: Must be to prepare for or respond to: (A) use or threatened use of weapon of mass destruction; (B) terrorist attack or threatened terrorist attack; (C) intentional or unintentional release of hazardous chemical, biological, or radiological materials that could result in catastrophic loss of life or property; or (D) a natural disaster that could result in catastrophic loss of life.

Document Description: Specifies that the purpose of reserve components is to provide trained units and qualified persons in time of war or national emergency or "at such other times as the national security may require."

Document Description: Allows the Red Cross to use and maintain buildings for storage of supplies for a serious national disaster, under such conditions as the Secretary of Defense shall provide.

Document Description: Requires HHS to submit annually a report that describes the actions taken by the USFG and private entities to facilitate the adoption of a nationwide system for the electronic use and exchange of health information; describes barriers to adoption of such a system; and contains recommendations to achieve full implementation of this system.
Entity Empowered: Department of Health and Human Services
Funding Stream Description: Appropriates funds for the creation and maintenance of an annual report on this system/process.

Document Description: Allows the Secretary of a military department to lend equipment under the jurisdiction of that department, which can temporarily be spared, to any organization formed by the American National Red Cross that needs it for instruction and practice for the purpose of aiding the Army, Navy, or Air Force in a time of war.
Entity Empowered: Department of Defense

Document Description: Allows the Secretary of Defense to make available for humanitarian relief purposes and domestic emergency assistance any nonlethal excess supplies of the DoD. Additionally allows distribution of excess supplies to homeless veterans.  Transfers supplies to the Secretary of Homeland Security but allows DoD to help distribute supplies at request of DHS
Entity Empowered: Department of Homeland Security,Department of Defense

Document Description: Allows the Department of Defense to use appropriations for humanitarian assistance to transport supplies for humanitarian purpose; in addition, (b) allows for these supplies to be used to mitigate the effects of an event or condition like an oil spill that "threatens serious harm to the environment" if other sources to transport goods are not readily available. The Secretary may require reimbursement for these services.
Entity Empowered: Department of Defense
Describe Health Emergency: Non-humanitarian relief requires an event or condition like an oil spill that "threatens serious harm to the environment"
Funding Stream Description: Allows appropriations to be used to clean up environmental disasters in certain circumstances

Document Description: Requires governors to create emergency response commissions, with people who have technical expertise in the emergency management field. These people are to create emergency planning districts and plan responses to potential health crises. Where emergency planning involves more than one state, there may be multi jurisdictional planning organizations.
Entity Empowered: State Governments/Governors

Document Description: Requires the establishment of an agricultural biosecurity communication center to collect and disseminate information and prepare for agricultural disease emergencies, agroterrorist attacks, or other threats to agricultural biosecurity, as well as to coordinate activities within DHS regarding the above.
Entity Empowered: Department of Homeland Security

Document Description: Defines a "weapon of mass destruction" and makes it a crime to attempt or conspire to use a WMD in a number of circumstances against the U.S., within the U.S., or as a U.S. national. Defines WMD as any destructive device; any weapon that is designed or intended to cause death or serious bodily injury through the release, dissemination, or impact of toxic or poisonous chemicals or their precursors, a biological agent, toxin or vector, or a weapon designed to release radiation at a level dangerous to human life.
Entity Empowered: Department of Justice,Department of Justice - Federal Bureau of Investigation
Describe Health Emergency: Requires attempt, conspiracy, or use of a WMD.

Document Description: Requires Secretary of Agriculture to maintain a list of biological agents and toxins that pose a severe threat to animal or plant health and/or products. Also stipulates that Secretary shall by regulation shall provide for safety procedures for transferring these agents; proper training for dealing with these agents; and proper laboratory facilities to contain them. The Secretary will also establish and enforce safety measures to prevent such toxins from being used in international terrorism or for criminal purposes. The Secretary will also establish procedures to protect animal and plant health in the event of a transfer in violation of these safety procedures. There will be a registry of people who have access to these agents.
Entity Empowered: Department of Agriculture

Document Description: The Secretary of Agriculture may conduct a program of wildlife services with respect to injurious animal species, including actions to control the spread of zoonotic diseases. The Secretary is authorized to make such expenditures as necessary to execute these functions.
Entity Empowered: Department of Agriculture
Funding Stream Description: Appropriates funding for controlling zoonotic diseases and the animals that might carry them

Document Description: Authorizes Secretary of Agriculture with notice to Secretary of Treasury and public notice to restrict the importation or entry of any animal that the Secretary deems necessary to prevent the introduction of any pest or disease of livestock; to prevent the movement of any animal determined as such; or to restrict the use of any such animal if the Secretary determines that such a restriction is necessary because the means of conveyance has not been maintained in a clean or sanitary condition/does not have accommodations for the safe and proper movement of livestock. Allows the Secretary of Agriculture to promulgate regulations with respect to the above. Creates authority for orders to disinfect to owners of livestock.
Entity Empowered: Department of Agriculture
Describe Health Emergency: Must be deemed necessary to prevent the introduction of any pest or disease of livestock.

Document Description: Authorizes Secretary of Agriculture to prevent the exportation of livestock if: (1) necessary to prevent dissemination from or within the United States of any pest or disease of livestock; (2) if the livestock is unfit to be moved; (3) if the method of conveyance is unsafe, risky, or has not been maintained in a clean or sanitary condition. Provides for orders to disinfect.
Entity Empowered: Department of Agriculture
Describe Health Emergency: Must be deemed necessary to prevent the introduction or export of any pest or disease of livestock.

Document Description: Authorizes Secretary of Agriculture to prohibit or restrict the movement in interstate commerce of any animal, article, or means of conveyance, if deemed necessary to prevent the introduction or dissemination of any pest or disease of livestock; and any conveyance in connection with moving animals deemed necessary to do the above.
Entity Empowered: Department of Agriculture
Describe Health Emergency: Must be deemed necessary to prevent the introduction or export of any pest or disease of livestock.

Document Description: Authorizes Secretary of Agriculture to "hold, seize, quarantine, treat, destroy, dispose of, or take other remedial action" with respect to any animal that may pose a threat of disseminating or infecting livestock with a pest. The Secretary may also seize, hold, treat, apply other remedial actions, to, destroy, or otherwise dispose of any facility, article, or means of conveyance necessary to prevent the dissemination of disease. If owners fail to comply with orders, Secretary may take enhanced remedial actions.
Entity Empowered: Department of Agriculture
Describe Health Emergency: Must be deemed necessary to prevent the introduction or export of any pest or disease of livestock.

Document Description: Authorizes Secretary of Agriculture to carry out operations and measures to "detect, control, or eradicate" any pest or disease of livestock, including drawing blood and diagnostic testing, at any point of concentration.
Entity Empowered: Department of Agriculture
Describe Health Emergency: Must be deemed necessary to prevent the introduction or export of any pest or disease of livestock.

Document Description: Authorizes Secretary of Agriculture to cooperate with other federal agencies, States, political subdivisions of states, national, state, or local governments of foreign countries, Indian tribes, domestic or international organizations/associations to carry out livestock disease prevention functions. Additionally, the Secretary of Agriculture may produce and sell sterile screwworms to any foreign country, international government or association if the livestock industry will not be adversely affected by the production and sale.
